question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Each person marked the table with an X on the day(s) he/she would not be able to attend a meeting. On which day can the most people attend a meeting?

\begin{tabular}{|l|c|c|c|c|c|}
\multicolumn{6}{c}{}\\\hline
&Mon&Tues&Wed&Thurs&Fri\\\hline
Anna&X&&X&&\\\hline
Bill&&X&&X&X\\\hline
Carl&X&X&&X&X\\\hline
\end{tabular}
inference:
**Solution:**
On Monday, we can see 2 are available (Bill and Carl).
On Tuesday, 3 are available (Anna, Bill, Carl).
On Wednesday, 1 is available (Anna).
On Thursday, 2 are available (Anna and Carl).
On Friday, 1 is available (Bill).

The most people who can attend a meeting is 3, on Tuesday.

**Final Answer: \\boxed{Tuesday}. I hope it is correct.**
ground_truth: On each day but Wednesday, only one person can attend a meeting. On Wednesday, two people can. Thus, the day on which the most people can attend a meeting is $\boxed{\text{Wednesday}}.$
